channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Carlos Alcaraz wins the French Open, earning a third Grand Slam title
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz beat Alexander Zverev, taking his first championship at the French Open and third Grand Slam title in all.
item.content:encoded:
Carlos Alcaraz beat Alexander Zverev, taking his first championship at the French Open and third Grand Slam title in all.

(Image credit: Thibault Camus)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Benny Ganz, a key member of Israel's war cabinet, has resigned
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: California wildfire smoke linked to early deaths
item.description: A new study finds that during smoky years like 2018, when the town of Paradise burned down, more than 10,000 people died prematurely. It's a wake-up call about the scale of the problem, they say.
item.content:encoded: A new study finds that during smoky years like 2018, when the town of Paradise burned down, more than 10,000 people died prematurely. It's a wake-up call about the scale of the problem, they say.
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: 'World Class' collects the work of late sports journalist Grant Wahl
item.description: A new book collects the work of sports journalist Grant Wahl, who died suddenly while covering the 2022 FIFA World Cup.
item.content:encoded: A new book collects the work of sports journalist Grant Wahl, who died suddenly while covering the 2022 FIFA World Cup.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: The trial of Hunter Biden enters its second week
item.description: Federal prosecutors rested their case Friday in the federal gun trial of Hunter Biden. The case could wrap as early as this week.
item.content:encoded: Federal prosecutors rested their case Friday in the federal gun trial of Hunter Biden. The case could wrap as early as this week.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: What does the end of pandemic recovery funds mean for schools and students?
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Far-right gains in EU elections deal defeats to France's Macron and Germany's Scholz
item.description: European Union parliamentary elections dealt stunning defeats to two of the bloc's most important leaders: French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz.
item.content:encoded:
European Union parliamentary elections dealt stunning defeats to two of the bloc's most important leaders: French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz.

(Image credit: Lewis Joly)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: WNBA star Caitlin Clark doesn't make the USA Olympics basketball team
item.description: The Indiana Fever rookie confirmed she wasn't selected to join the national team at the Summer Games in Paris. The tentative roster includes stars Brittney Griner and Breanna Stewart.
item.content:encoded:
The Indiana Fever rookie confirmed she wasn't selected to join the national team at the Summer Games in Paris. The tentative roster includes stars Brittney Griner and Breanna Stewart.

(Image credit: Doug McSchooler)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: India's prime minister, humbled by voters, is sworn in again
item.description: For the first time, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will lead a coalition after his party was humbled in its traditional stronghold of the Hindi-speaking belt of northern India.
item.content:encoded:
For the first time, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will lead a coalition after his party was humbled in its traditional stronghold of the Hindi-speaking belt of northern India.

(Image credit: Money Sharma)
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Benny Gantz resigns as Israeli war cabinet member
item.description: Gantz followed through on his plan to resign from Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's emergency government on Sunday citing its failure to advance a plan to defeat Hamas in Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
Gantz followed through on his plan to resign from Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's emergency government on Sunday citing its failure to advance a plan to defeat Hamas in Gaza.

(Image credit: Tasos Katopodis)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf
